text:
Hi guys, is there a way to search for one topic out of a list to be inserted into an argument for recent blog posts?

Eg:

`blog_recent_topic_posts('default', ' ', 1)`

For the second parameter, I need one of the following when the user clicks on a given topic: `asia-pacific`, `airports`, `insight-reports`

We're getting to the point where Iwe'll have to write multiple if/else statements to get the result but this is very counter-intuitive
Any help on this would be greatly appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:
When the user clicks, it takes them to a new page, correct? Just want to make sure you're not trying to filter on the same page load, that's something you'd need to do in JS instead of HubL

Hi Mark, yeah it takes them to a new page. Basically what is happening is we have a featured post, but it's currently displaying on every topic page. We need the latest topic post to be in place when the user clicks
<https://www.oag.com/blog>

OK, just for my clarification, you want the overall featured post only on the main listing page, then on topic pages you want the ".featured-post" styled post to default to the first post in that topic, right?
Yeah that's correct
Any ideas on this <@U26BLKGE4>?

Hey, sorry, had to jump on some meetings and projects. My first thought would be loading the blog posts into an array, then feeding the information for the first one to that featured post module (do some googling on the jinja .append method). I haven't messed around with topic listing pages in a while, so I can't remember off the top of my head if there's an easier way, but I should get a chance to play around with some code tonight if you can't find an answer.
No worries, thanks Mark, really appreciate your advice here :thumbsup:
:thumbsup:

Guys, how can I have some fields inside the deal details that will be used to the operator type the credit card info to call a payment gateway and prevent HubSpot from saving that information? :closed_lock_with_key::credit_card:
<@UB1TT8UAE> What is the case for this?
It's an ONG that receive donation with credit card by the phone and use a local payment gateway.
eww...
cant happen with a HubSpot form....
emailing the CC number is not a great idea anyways.

Hey everyone! :wave: What's the best way to reorganize (move) files in Design Tools? Our current setup is a mess so we've are come up with a new folder structure. We've tried using Drag & Drop/Move but at the time it was slow for us.
Is anyone else finding that templates previews are duplicating code? e.g. this is the HubSpot tools menu at the top right, but it's being rendered twice (along with all my javascript files)
Hey <@UD72TL71U>, the team’s aware of this and working on a fix as we speak. This should only be affecting template previews (not live content)
Awesome to hear! Thanks for the quick response :simple_smile:
Of course!!
